Five solid state detectors were employed. A sixth detector was continually exposed to a source of known intensity and served as a calibration sensor such that the degradation of the five detectors due to the space radiation environment could be determined. Three of 9-15 the five detectors were shielded silicon cells while the other two were CdTe thin film cells. Results on the CdTe cells, as constructed, indicated they could not satisfactorily withstand a space environment(1S).
